meanings.definition: Of or relating to oak trees.
meanings.sent1: The quercetic leaves rustled in the wind.
meanings.sent2: The forest was filled with the quercetic scent of oak trees.
meanings.sent3: The quercetic acorns played hide-and-seek with the squirrels.
meanings.sent4: Her hair cascaded down her back like a quercetic waterfall.
meanings.sent5: The quercetic bark of the oak tree was rough to the touch.

meanings.definition: A compound found in oak trees.
meanings.sent1: Scientists discovered a new quercetic in the oak extract.
meanings.sent2: The quercetic was extracted from the oak bark for research.
meanings.sent3: The quercetic seemed to have a mind of its own, jumping around in the test tube.
meanings.sent4: His words were like a quercetic, spreading wisdom wherever they landed.
meanings.sent5: The quercetic in the oak trees provided a natural defense mechanism.

meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of oak trees.
meanings.sent1: Her quercetic brown eyes sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The quercetic furniture in the cabin gave it a cozy feel.
meanings.sent3: The quercetic pattern on the fabric reminded her of home.
meanings.sent4: The old house had a quercetic charm that drew in visitors.
meanings.sent5: The quercetic landscape painted a picture of tranquility and strength.
